title: Softbank's Son says super AI could make humans like fish, win Nobel Prize
description: SoftBank chief Masayoshi Son told South Korea’s president that future artificial super-intelligence could be thousands of times smarter than humans — leaving people “like fish” by comparison. He joked AI might even win a Nobel Prize in Literature. Son said ASI wouldn’t threaten humans, though President Lee admitted the idea was unsettling.
content:

title: AI guru warns AI could kill 80 per cent of jobs soon, replacing surgeons, coders and even CEOs
description: AI pioneer Stuart Russell has expressed concerns over the potential impact of artificial intelligence on the job market. At a time when most tech companies have laid off thousands of employees, Russell believes that AI can one day even replace CEOs.
content: Artificial intelligence (AI) is changing the world as we speak. Fears of AI replacing jobs are common. Many big tech companies have already laid off thousands of employees in favour of greater AI integration. However, according to AI guru Stuart Russ... [2075 chars]

title: Anthropic Chief Scientist Jared Kaplan warns AI could replace most white-collar jobs within 3 years: Here’s why
description: According to Anthropic chief scientist Jared Kaplan, artificial intelligence is rapidly evolving into a system capable of handling not just simple office tasks but also complex reasoning-analysis.
content:
Artificial intelligence is advancing at a pace that few people have only expected, and several experts now warn that major changes to white-collar jobs could arrive much sooner than anticipated.

title: WhatsApp faces European antitrust investigation over artificial intelligence
description: WhatsApp faces an antitrust investigation in the European Union, where regulators said Thursday that they're looking into the messaging service's AI policy.
content:

title: Meta shifts resources from metaverse to AI glasses amid budget shifts
description: Meta shifts resources from metaverse projects to artificial-intelligence-powered glasses and wearables as the company considers shifting Reality Labs budget.
content:
Meta is dialing back its metaverse ambitions and redirecting resources toward AI-powered glasses and wearable technology, the company told FOX Business on Thursday.

title: Fake rape victim admits to AI hoax prompted by TikTok challenge
description: A Florida woman confessed that she lied about being raped by a homeless man, whose photo she generated using artificial intelligence, to complete a viral TikTok challenge.
content:
